title: Basics of Human Immunity
content: The immune system protects the body from infections using white blood cells, antibodies, and physical barriers like skin and mucous membranes.

title: Balanced Diet Essentials
content: A balanced diet includes proteins, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water. It supports growth, energy production, and overall health.

title: Hypertension Overview
content: Hypertension is a chronic condition in which blood pressure remains consistently high, increasing risks of heart attack and stroke.

title: First Aid for Burns
content: Cool minor burns under running water for 20 minutes, avoid ice, and apply a sterile dressing. Severe burns require immediate medical care.

title: Mental Health Awareness
content: Mental health includes emotional and psychological well-being. Common disorders include anxiety and depression, which benefit from early treatment.

title: Type 2 Diabetes Basics
content: Type 2 diabetes occurs when the body becomes resistant to insulin, often due to lifestyle, genetics, and physical inactivity.

title: Importance of Hydration
content: Proper hydration supports digestion, metabolic function, temperature regulation, and brain performance.

title: Common Cold Symptoms
content: The common cold causes coughing, runny nose, sneezing, and mild fever. Most cases resolve within 7–10 days.

title: Role of Sleep in Health
content: Sleep promotes physical healing, memory consolidation, and emotional regulation. Adults need 7–9 hours per night.

title: Human Digestive Process
content: Digestion involves breaking down food into nutrients using the stomach, intestines, and digestive enzymes.

title: Basics of Lung Function
content: Lungs supply oxygen to the body and remove carbon dioxide through respiration.

title: Healthy Skin Care
content: Skin health is maintained through hydration, sun protection, and gentle cleansing to prevent irritation and infections.

title: Basics of Nutrition Labels
content: Nutrition labels show calories, serving size, and nutrients to help consumers make healthy choices.

title: Asthma Overview
content: Asthma is a chronic respiratory condition involving airway inflammation and narrowing that causes wheezing and breathlessness.

title: Vitamin D Importance
content: Vitamin D supports immune function, bone strength, and calcium absorption. Sunlight is a major source.

title: Healthy Heart Habits
content: Regular exercise, low sodium intake, and avoiding tobacco help maintain heart health.

title: Human Circulatory System
content: The circulatory system transports oxygen, nutrients, and hormones throughout the body via blood vessels.

title: Anemia Causes
content: Anemia results from low hemoglobin or red blood cell count, often due to iron deficiency, blood loss, or disease.

title: Stress Management Techniques
content: Stress can be reduced through breathing exercises, mindfulness, and regular physical activity.

title: Calcium for Bone Health
content: Calcium strengthens bones and teeth. Dairy, leafy greens, and fortified foods are common sources.

title: Hand Hygiene Importance
content: Handwashing removes germs and prevents infections such as colds, flu, and stomach illnesses.

title: COVID-19 Basics
content: COVID-19 is caused by SARS-CoV-2 and spreads through droplets. Symptoms include fever, cough, and fatigue.

title: Influenza Overview
content: Influenza is a contagious respiratory infection causing fever, aches, and cough. Vaccination lowers risk.

title: Healthy Vision Practices
content: Eye health is supported through regular exams, reduced screen strain, and proper lighting.

title: Iron-Rich Foods
content: Iron supports red blood cell production. Food sources include spinach, lentils, and red meat.

title: Basics of Blood Donation
content: Blood donation is a safe process that helps save lives. Donors must meet age, weight, and health criteria.

title: Identifying Dehydration
content: Dehydration symptoms include thirst, dry mouth, dizziness, dark urine, and fatigue.

title: Human Nervous System
content: The nervous system includes the brain, spinal cord, and nerves that control body functions and reactions.

title: Healthy Weight Maintenance
content: Maintaining a healthy weight involves balanced eating, portion control, and regular physical activity.

title: Protein Importance
content: Protein supports muscle growth, tissue repair, enzyme function, and immune health.

title: Basics of Cardiovascular Health
content: A healthy cardiovascular system is supported by exercise, healthy eating, and avoiding smoking.

title: Dental Hygiene Basics
content: Brushing twice daily and flossing prevent tooth decay, gum disease, and bad breath.

title: Allergy Overview
content: Allergies occur when the immune system overreacts to substances like pollen, dust, or food.

title: Pain Management Basics
content: Pain can be managed using medication, stretching, heat therapy, and physical therapy.

title: Human Kidney Function
content: Kidneys filter waste from the blood, maintain fluid balance, and regulate minerals.

title: Healthy Aging Tips
content: Healthy aging involves staying active, eating nutrient-rich foods, and remaining socially engaged.

title: Basics of Viruses
content: Viruses are microscopic infectious agents that require host cells for replication.

title: Basics of Bacteria
content: Bacteria are single-celled organisms that can be beneficial or harmful depending on the species.

title: Child Nutrition Essentials
content: Children need balanced meals rich in vitamins, minerals, protein, and healthy fats to support growth.

title: Human Muscular System
content: The muscular system enables movement and consists of skeletal, cardiac, and smooth muscles.

title: Healthy Breakfast Importance
content: A healthy breakfast boosts energy, improves concentration, and supports metabolism throughout the day.

title: Basics of Cholesterol
content: Cholesterol is essential for cell structure but high levels increase the risk of heart disease.

title: First Aid for Cuts
content: To treat a cut, clean the wound, apply pressure, and use a sterile bandage to prevent infection.

title: Human Liver Function
content: The liver detoxifies blood, produces bile for digestion, and stores nutrients.

title: Benefits of Walking
content: Walking daily supports cardiovascular health, strengthens muscles, and reduces stress.

title: Basics of Immune Boosting
content: A strong immune system is supported by sleep, hydration, exercise, and nutrient-rich foods.

title: Types of Headaches
content: Headaches include tension, migraine, and cluster types, each with different triggers and symptoms.

title: Human Skeleton Basics
content: The skeleton supports the body, protects organs, and enables movement in coordination with muscles.

title: Food Poisoning Symptoms
content: Food poisoning causes vomiting, diarrhea, cramps, and fever due to contaminated food or drink.

title: Basics of Blood Pressure
content: Blood pressure measures the force of blood against artery walls. Normal levels are around 120/80 mmHg.

title: Healthy Hair Care
content: Healthy hair care includes regular washing, conditioning, and avoiding excessive heat or chemical treatments.

title: Human Brain Basics
content: The brain controls memory, movement, emotions, and body functions through billions of connected neurons.

title: Safe Food Storage
content: Proper food storage prevents bacterial growth and reduces the risk of foodborne illness.

title: Basics of Anxiety
content: Anxiety involves persistent worry, nervousness, and physical symptoms like rapid heartbeat and restlessness.

title: Prenatal Nutrition
content: Prenatal nutrition includes folic acid, iron, calcium, and balanced meals to support fetal development.

title: Healthy Sleep Routine
content: A consistent sleep routine improves focus, mood, and long-term health. Adults typically need 7–9 hours.

title: Basics of Vaccination
content: Vaccines prepare the immune system to recognize and fight infectious diseases safely.

title: Human Eye Structure
content: The eye contains structures such as the cornea, lens, retina, and optic nerve to enable vision.

title: Healthy Lung Habits
content: Avoiding smoking, staying active, and breathing clean air helps maintain lung function.

title: High-Fiber Foods
content: High-fiber foods include oats, beans, fruit, and vegetables, which support digestion and heart health.

title: Basics of Metabolism
content: Metabolism includes chemical reactions that convert food into energy for cellular functions.

title: Human Reproductive System
content: The reproductive system includes organs responsible for producing gametes and supporting reproduction.

title: Basics of Dehydration
content: Dehydration occurs when fluid intake is insufficient, causing dizziness, headache, and fatigue.

title: Healthy Snacking
content: Healthy snacks like fruit, nuts, and yogurt provide energy and essential nutrients between meals.

title: Basics of Fever
content: Fever is the body's natural response to infection, helping eliminate pathogens by raising temperature.

title: Benefits of Yoga
content: Yoga improves flexibility, reduces stress, strengthens muscles, and enhances mental well-being.

title: Basics of BMI
content: BMI is a screening tool that assesses weight classification using height and weight ratios.

title: Human Endocrine System
content: The endocrine system regulates hormones controlling metabolism, growth, reproduction, and stress response.

title: Healthy Hydration Habits
content: Drinking water regularly, especially during heat or physical activity, helps maintain fluid balance.

title: Basics of Antibiotics
content: Antibiotics treat bacterial infections but do not work against viral illnesses. Misuse causes resistance.

title: Healthy Joint Care
content: Stretching, staying active, and maintaining good posture helps protect joint health.

title: Sun Protection Basics
content: Using sunscreen and wearing protective clothing reduces risks of sunburn and skin cancer.

title: Basics of Digestion
content: Digestion breaks down food into nutrients absorbed by the body for energy and growth.

title: Human Immune Response
content: The immune response identifies pathogens and produces antibodies to defend against infections.

title: Healthy Blood Sugar Levels
content: Maintaining stable blood sugar prevents fatigue and reduces the risk of developing diabetes.

title: Common Food Allergens
content: Common food allergens include peanuts, milk, eggs, wheat, soy, fish, and shellfish, which can trigger immune reactions.

title: Human Hearing System
content: The ear converts sound waves into nerve signals through the cochlea and auditory nerve.

title: Basics of CPR
content: CPR involves chest compressions and rescue breaths to maintain circulation during cardiac arrest.

title: Healthy Meal Planning
content: Meal planning helps balance nutrients, control portions, and support consistent healthy eating habits.

title: Basics of Stress
content: Stress causes physical and mental responses. Chronic stress can weaken the immune system and affect overall health.

title: Importance of Probiotics
content: Probiotics are beneficial bacteria that support digestion, nutrient absorption, and gut health.

title: Human Skin Layers
content: The skin consists of the epidermis, dermis, and hypodermis, which protect the body and regulate temperature.

title: Healthy Posture Tips
content: Maintaining correct posture reduces back pain, improves breathing, and supports musculoskeletal health.

title: Omega-3 Benefits
content: Omega-3 fatty acids support heart, brain, and joint health and help reduce inflammation.

title: Basics of Allergic Reactions
content: Allergic reactions occur when the immune system overreacts to allergens, causing itching, swelling, or breathing issues.

title: Human Blood Composition
content: Blood consists of red blood cells, white blood cells, platelets, and plasma, each with vital functions.

title: Healthy Liver Habits
content: Limiting alcohol, staying hydrated, and eating nutrient-rich foods help support liver health.

title: Basics of Wound Healing
content: Wound healing occurs in four stages: hemostasis, inflammation, proliferation, and remodeling.

title: Importance of Fiber
content: Fiber aids digestion, maintains bowel health, and helps regulate blood sugar levels.

title: Human Respiratory System
content: The respiratory system manages breathing and gas exchange between the lungs and bloodstream.

title: Basics of Immunization
content: Immunization protects individuals from infectious diseases by stimulating immune memory.

title: Healthy Pregnancy Tips
content: A healthy pregnancy involves proper nutrition, hydration, prenatal vitamins, and regular medical checkups.

title: Importance of Stretching
content: Regular stretching improves flexibility, reduces injury risk, and relieves muscle tension.

title: Common Cold Prevention
content: Washing hands, getting enough sleep, and avoiding close contact with sick individuals help prevent colds.

title: Healthy Hydration Signs
content: Clear urine, good energy levels, and normal skin elasticity are signs of proper hydration.

title: Basics of Minerals
content: Minerals like iron, calcium, and potassium support bone strength, nerve function, and fluid balance.

title: Human Reflex Actions
content: Reflex actions are rapid, involuntary responses controlled by the spinal cord for protection.

title: Benefits of Strength Training
content: Strength training improves muscle mass, metabolism, bone density, and overall functional fitness.

title: Healthy Eating Patterns
content: Healthy eating emphasizes whole foods, lean proteins, vegetables, fruits, and limited processed foods.

title: Basics of Oxygen Transport
content: Red blood cells transport oxygen from the lungs to tissues using hemoglobin molecules.
